description: Discharge of Condition 16 (Details of landscaping area, cycle enclosure, paving and boundary treatment), Condition 19 (Cycle Parking) and Condition 23 (Nature Conservation) of planning application 16/12324/FUL (Demolition of all existing buildings (save for the listed building) at 18-20 Borough Road, and redevelopment to provide 11 houses, 3 flats (within the listed building) and 585sqm of employment floor space together with 16 parking spaces) dated 24/02/2017
decision_conditions: Due to the:- insufficient and unacceptable information submitted regarding the proposed boundary treatment; and,- the unaccpetable siting of the proposed commercial cycle store;the details submitted regarding Condition 16 (Details of landscaping area, cycle enclosure, paving and boundary treatment) of planning permission 16/12324/FUL are considered not to ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Due to the unaccpetable siting of the proposed commercial cycle store the details submitted regarding Condition 19 (Cycle Parking) of planning permission 16/12324/FUL are considered not to to ensure the provision of satisfactory cycle storage facilities and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with Policy DM8 (Sustainable Transport for New Developments) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Due to the insufficient and unacceptable information provided, the details submitted for Condition 23 (Biodiversity) of planning permission 16/12324/FUL are considered not to safeguard and protect the sites biodiversity and nature conservation value in accordance with Policy DM6 (Biodiversity) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The details submitted for Condition 12 (Refuse and Recycling) are considered sufficient and have ensured proper waste management in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 5.17 and 7.4 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The site comprises a mid-terrace dwelling with a hardstanding driveway and square bay window.Consultations- 5 neighbouring properties have been notified and no representations have been received. - RBK Highways Officer objects to the proposal.The key areas of assessment are:- The design of the proposed development; - The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings; and,- The impact of the development on Highway safety.When read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. Officer Comment: Officers note that a number of properties on the road have dropped kerbs and it is considered that there would be no further adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development. Policy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officer Comment:  It is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy.The NPPF requires that in assessing applications for development, it is ensured that: appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport modes can be - or have been - taken up; safe and suitable access to the site can be achieved for all users; and any significant impacts from the development on the transport network (in terms of capacity and congestion), or on highway safety, can be cost effectively mitigated to an acceptable degree.Development should only be prevented or refused on highways grounds if there would be an unacceptable impact on highway safety, or the residual cumulative impacts on the road network would be severe.Policies DM9 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy together with the Council's Sustainable Transport SPD 2013  seek to ensure that new development has regard to local traffic conditions and does not contribute to congestion or compromise highway safety and for proposals to comply with the car parking standards in the London Plan. Officer Comment: The RBK Highways officer have provided a comment; objecting to the proposal:The proposed crossover would not meet the requirements of the RBK Crossover Policy with respect to distance from the junction with Amberwood Rise and encroachment onto the pedestrian crossing markings on Malden Road. As such it is not supported by Highways on grounds of highway safety.For these reasons, officers consider that the applicant has failed to demonstrate that the proposal would not have an adverse impact on highway safety. The proposal is therefore contrary to Paragrah 111 of the NPPF, 2021 and policies DM9 and DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy 2012In conclusion, the proposed development would not be in general accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan (2021), Policies of the Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).

Fee - The fee required for your planning application is £258.  Payment can be made online via the Kingston council website, via our Contact Centre on 020 8547 5002, or by cheque made payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames.

Please provide Existing Floor Plans, i.e. to show the dwelling before the extension was built. Plans must be at a recognised scale (at 1:50 or 1:100 for example), showing the outline of the entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions. The plans must also show the direction of North. Although the inclusion of a scale bar is not mandatory, it is encouraged.

Please provide Existing Elevations, i.e. before the extension was built, at a recognised scale (at 1:50 or 1:100 for example), showing all elevations not just part and indicating key dimensions. Although the inclusion of a scale bar is not mandatory, it is encouraged.
